alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 23 at 7:24PM MDT until May 23 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL CUSTER COUNTY... At 724 PM MDT, Emergency management reported flash flooding already occurring in the warned area, including fast flows within usually dry creek beds and drainages. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 an inch are possible in the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Strawberry Hill Recreation Area. The Tongue River will see localized rises due to downstream flow from the warned area. This includes the following streams and drainages... Strevell Creek, Ash Creek, Paddy Fay Creek, Powder River, Cowles Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Johnson Creek, Bensley Creek, North Strevell Creek, Tongue River, Mill Creek, East Jones Creek, Squaw Creek, Meadow Creek, Alkali Creek, Jones Creek, Whitney Creek, East Fork Mill Creek, Pumpkin Creek, Little Cottonwood Creek, Kircher Creek, South Fork Jones Creek and Laney Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
